text: days that you would normally see that
system is tie in at your command this is
john markoff reporting from Fort Benning
Georgia where I attended something
called a robotic rodeo home event
sponsored annually by the Army's
research and development center for
ground robot vehicles during a week-long
exercise in October military contractors
demonstrated ground robots intended for
surveillance logistics and war fighting
one of the demonstrations was of a robot
called Mars that stands for modular
advanced to arm robotic system it is
intended to be operated wirelessly by a
soldier with a small backpack and a
handheld controller Mars can be operated
in tandem with a smaller Scout robot
called Dragon runner and a tiny drone
aircraft called Raven Mars rolls onto
the scene and as its video camera
swivels around it senses a threat on a
nearby rooftop after the visitors to the
rodeo were given some time to put in
earplugs the engineer operating Mars
went through some safety checks and the
weapon fired this is john markoff from
Fort Benning Georgia
